pullRequest.body:
Generalize the content of Flat/Basic to Semirings requires generalizing a lemma in RingTheory/Finiteness/TensorProduct. The last part of the file concerning CharacterModule can't be generalized due to three difficulties: 1) Baer's criterion for injective modules doesn't work over a semiring; 2) Q/Z isn't an injective object in the category of AddCommMonoids, in fact this category [doesn't have enough injectives](https://mathoverflow.net/questions/277284/which-semirings-have-enough-injectives-in-their-category-of-modules); 3) homs into Q/Z does not distinguish points in an AddCommMonoid.

It's therefore unclear whether the definition (preservation of injectivity for inclusion of ideals) implies preservation of injectivity of arbitrary linear maps over semirings, even though this has been proven over rings. Therefore, as we generalize `IsLocalization.flat` to semirings, we also provide `IsLocalization.lTensor_preserves_injective_linearMap`.

(Notice that monomorphisms in the category of AddCommMonoids still coincide with injective homs, but there are more epimorphisms than surjective homs, e.g. the inclusion of N in Z.)

---

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

source.title: chore(RingTheory/Flat): tensor with localization preserves injectivity even over semirings
